qas.question: What is the name of the 360's online service?
What is the name of the feature that allows users to download games from Live?
What can people owning both a PC and 360 do?
What is the name of the 360's motion sensing camera peripheral?
The 360's multimedia capabilities transformed it from a game console to what?

answers.text: a hub for living-room computing entertainment

qas.question: What was the name of the orginal Xbox's streaming service?
What service only offered subscription services?
What do PCs use to stream media?
What is the name of the additional hard drive storage?
What is the name of the feature that allows Live users to play game demos?

context: The Xbox 360 features an online service, <a0_0><b5_0>Xbox Live<b5_0/><a0_0/>, which was expanded from its previous iteration on the original Xbox and received regular updates during the console's lifetime. Available in free and subscription-based varieties, <b6_0>Xbox Live<b6_0/> allows users to: play games online; download games (through <a1_0><b9_0>Xbox Live Arcade<b9_0/><a1_0/>) and game demos; purchase and stream music, television programs, and films through the Xbox Music and Xbox Video portals; and access third-party content services through media streaming applications. In addition to online multimedia features, the <b7_0>Xbox 360<b7_0/> allows users to <a2_0>stream media<a2_0/> from local PCs. Several peripherals have been released, including wireless controllers, expanded hard drive storage, and <a3_0>the <b8_0>Kinect<b8_0/><a3_0/> motion sensing camera. The release of these additional services and peripherals helped the Xbox brand grow from gaming-only to encompassing all multimedia, turning it into <a4_0>a hub for living-room computing entertainment<a4_0/>.
